info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Davie, east central Iredell and northwestern Rowan Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Statesville, or 6 miles north of Cleveland, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Statesville, Bermuda Run, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Fork Church, Advance, Sheffield, Farmington and Woodleaf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for the Piedmont of North Carolina.
